clinical_study.brief_title: Urgent Care for the Elderly: Impairment and Home Care Services
clinical_study.official_title: Urgent Care for the Elderly: Impairment and Home Care Services

brief_summary.textblock:
Elderly population is increasing quickly and their need for health care ressources through emergency care is also growing. While these patients are ageing physical impairment often happens along the way. Apart from senior homes, different types and levels of home care services have been developped in order to overcome or to adapt to these situations.
Our goals are:
- to assess mortality rate depending on home care services level for the elderly population consulting in the ED or being taken in charge by the Emergency Medical System in France.
- to describe this population in terms of autonomy, impairment and home care services

primary_outcome.time_frame: At hospital discharge or 30 days at most

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Admission is decided on the first 24 hours after EMS or ED care, the day of the inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: Admission in a medical, surgical or psychiatric unit are considered

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires given the day of the inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: Different items in a questionnaire are asked to the patient or family concerning weekly home care services use for patient usually (which type and how often)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the ED visit (less than 24 hours), the day of the inclusion
secondary_outcome.description: Lab investigations, radiology, surgery, treatment administered

study_pop.textblock: All patients aged 80 and over visiting the ED, taking in charge by SMUR (medical EMS) or calling SAMU (medical call center) during 24 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients aged 80 and over
Exclusion Criteria:
- aged<80 years old
